passage:
(1) Artificial Intelligence (AI) has transformed from a distant sci-fi concept into an integral part of our everyday lives, often operating so seamlessly that we barely notice its presence. Modern smartphones utilize AI to recognize speech patterns, suggest predictive text, and enhance photography by automatically adjusting settings for optimal results. Virtual assistants like Siri, Alexa, and Google Assistant have become household names, standing ready to answer questions, play music, or control smart home devices through natural language commands that would have seemed miraculous just a decade ago.

(2) In professional environments, AI has fundamentally altered how we approach work and productivity. Automated email filtering systems protect us from spam while highlighting important messages. Translation tools break down language barriers in global business communications, allowing colleagues from different regions to collaborate effectively. Customer service has been revolutionized through chatbots that can resolve common issues instantly, freeing human agents to tackle more complex problems that require emotional intelligence and nuanced understanding.

(3) The entertainment industry has perhaps seen one of the most visible impacts of AI technology. Streaming services analyze viewing habits to recommend content tailored specifically to individual preferences, creating a personalized entertainment experience. Video games employ sophisticated AI to create responsive, challenging opponents that adapt to player behavior. Even music streaming platforms curate personalized playlists based on listening patterns, introducing users to new artists they might otherwise never discover.

(4) Despite these tremendous benefits, the rapid integration of AI into daily life has raised legitimate concerns about privacy, data security, and potential job displacement. Each interaction with AI-powered services generates data that companies can collect and analyze, creating detailed profiles of user behavior and preferences. This has sparked ongoing debates about the ethical boundaries of data collection and the need for transparent policies regarding how personal information is utilized and protected.

(5) As we move forward, finding the right balance between embracing AI's conveniences while establishing appropriate safeguards will be crucial. Educational systems must adapt to prepare students for a workforce increasingly shaped by automation and AI capabilities. Regulatory frameworks need to evolve to address new challenges while still allowing for innovation. Ultimately, the goal should be to harness AI as a tool that enhances human potential rather than replacing it, creating a future where technology and humanity coexist in a mutually beneficial relationship.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses the past perfect tense?

options.A: I have been working on this project since Monday.
options.B: She had finished her homework before dinner.
options.C: They are going to visit Paris next summer.
options.D: We will have completed the task by tomorrow.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct conditional form:

options.A: If I will see him, I will tell him the news.
options.B: If I would see him, I will tell him the news.
options.C: If I see him, I will tell him the news.
options.D: If I see him, I would tell him the news.

questions.question: Select the correct passive voice transformation of: 'Someone stole my bicycle last night.'

options.A: My bicycle has been stolen last night.
options.B: My bicycle was stolen last night.
options.C: My bicycle had stolen last night.
options.D: My bicycle is stolen last night.

questions.question: Which sentence contains a gerund phrase?

options.A: She wants to travel around the world.
options.B: Reading novels is her favorite hobby.
options.C: The man who called earlier is my uncle.
options.D: They will arrive tomorrow morning.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct use of reported speech:

options.A: She said that she is coming to the party.
options.B: He told me that he has finished the report.
options.C: They said that they will call later.
options.D: He said that he would help me the following day.

questions.question: Identify the sentence with the correct use of articles:

options.A: She is the best student in an entire school.
options.B: I bought a umbrella because it was raining.
options.C: The movie we saw last night was an excellent one.
options.D: He is expert in his field of study.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the correct form of the comparative?

options.A: This building is more taller than the one across the street.
options.B: Learning a new language is more easier than I expected.
options.C: The blue shirt is less expensive than the red one.
options.D: She runs more faster than her brother.

questions.question: Identify the sentence with the correct use of modals:

options.A: You must to attend the meeting tomorrow.
options.B: He can swimming very well.
options.C: She might be late for the concert.
options.D: They should to finish the project by Friday.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct use of relative pronouns:

options.A: The woman who house was damaged in the storm has moved.
options.B: The book which I borrowed from the library is very interesting.
options.C: The city where that we visited last summer was beautiful.
options.D: The man which lives next door is a doctor.

questions.question: Select the sentence with the correct subject-verb agreement:

options.A: The quality of these products have improved.
options.B: Neither of the students were able to solve the problem.
options.C: Each of the participants is required to bring identification.
options.D: The committee have reached a decision.

questions.question: Which sentence contains a correct use of the future perfect tense?

options.A: By this time next year, I will graduate from university.
options.B: By the end of this month, she will have completed the course.
options.C: They will be working on the project for six months.
options.D: We will travel to Japan in the spring.

questions.question: Choose the sentence with the correct use of prepositions:

options.A: She arrived to the airport at 9 PM.
options.B: We have been waiting since three hours.
options.C: The cat jumped onto the table and knocked over the vase.
options.D: They are interested about ancient history.

questions.question: Identify the sentence with the correct use of the past continuous tense:

options.A: When the phone rang, I was cooking dinner.
options.B: While I was cooking dinner, the phone rings.
options.C: I have been cooking dinner when the phone rang.
options.D: While I cooked dinner, I was answering the phone.

questions.question: Select the sentence that correctly uses a quantifier:

options.A: There are much people waiting in line.
options.B: She doesn't have many time to finish the project.
options.C: How many water do you drink each day?
options.D: There isn't enough evidence to support this theory.

questions.question: Which sentence has the correct word order?

options.A: Always she arrives to work on time.
options.B: Where you did go on your vacation?
options.C: I know not what to do in this situation.
options.D: He rarely has visited his hometown since moving abroad.

questions.question: Choose the correct phrasal verb to complete the sentence: 'After considering all options, they decided to _____ the proposal.'

options.A: go through with
options.B: look up to
options.C: come across
options.D: break down

questions.question: Select the correct collocation: 'The company needs to _____ a decision about the new product line.'

options.A: do
options.B: take
options.C: make
options.D: have

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'The assignment was difficult, but it wasn't exactly _____.'

options.A: a piece of cake
options.B: a cup of tea
options.C: a walk in the park
options.D: a breath of fresh air

questions.question: Choose the correct expression to show disagreement in a formal context:

options.A: No way!
options.B: I'm afraid I don't share your view on this matter.
options.C: You've got to be kidding me!
options.D: That's ridiculous!

questions.question: Select the appropriate linking word to complete the sentence: 'The weather was terrible; _____, we still enjoyed our vacation.'

options.A: therefore
options.B: furthermore
options.C: nevertheless
options.D: otherwise

questions.question: Which expression would be most appropriate to begin a formal email?

options.A: Hey there,
options.B: To whom it may concern,
options.C: What's up?
options.D: Yo!

questions.question: Choose the correct fixed expression: 'I'm really sorry, but I need to _____ our meeting tomorrow.'

options.A: call off
options.B: call out
options.C: call up
options.D: call in

questions.question: Select the most appropriate response to the statement: 'I'm sorry I'm late. The traffic was terrible.'

options.A: That's life.
options.B: Don't worry about it. These things happen.
options.C: You should have left earlier.
options.D: Whatever.

questions.question: Choose the correct word to complete the sentence: 'Despite the economic downturn, the company managed to _____ a profit last quarter.'

options.A: make
options.B: do
options.C: get
options.D: have

questions.question: Select the most appropriate expression to politely interrupt someone during a meeting:

options.A: Shut up for a minute!
options.B: I have something to say!
options.C: Excuse me, but may I add something here?
options.D: Listen to me now!

questions.question: Choose the correct definition of 'commitment':

options.A: The ability to change or be changed easily according to situations
options.B: A firm decision to do something or a promise to support someone or something
options.C: A unique or distinct characteristic that sets something apart
options.D: The state of being exposed to potential harm or attack

questions.question: What does 'flexible' mean?

options.A: Easily bent without breaking
options.B: Extremely large or great
options.C: Unique or distinctive in character
options.D: Weak or susceptible to attack

questions.question: Select the correct meaning of 'vulnerable':

options.A: Able to adapt to different circumstances
options.B: Having a strong determination
options.C: Exposed to potential harm or damage
options.D: Standing out as different or special

questions.question: Choose the correct definition of 'distinctive':

options.A: Extremely impressive or excellent
options.B: Easily adaptable to changing conditions
options.C: Having a quality that makes something different and special
options.D: Exposed to potential danger or harm

questions.question: What does 'tremendous' mean?

options.A: Very large, great, or impressive in amount or degree
options.B: Easily changeable or adaptable
options.C: Capable of being hurt or influenced negatively
options.D: Recognizably different from others

questions.question: Which definition best describes the word 'negotiate'?

options.A: To promise to do something
options.B: To discuss something in order to reach an agreement
options.C: To verify or confirm information
options.D: To strengthen or support something

questions.question: Select the correct meaning of 'coincide':

options.A: To happen at the same time or in the same place
options.B: To strengthen or support
options.C: To leave something or someone out
options.D: To give official permission for something

questions.question: Choose the best definition of 'reinforce':

options.A: To happen at the same time
options.B: To exclude or leave out
options.C: To strengthen or support something
options.D: To give official permission

questions.question: What does 'exclude' mean?

options.A: To strengthen or make something stronger
options.B: To give someone official permission to do something
options.C: To deny access to something or leave something out
options.D: To explain or prove that something is right or reasonable

questions.question: Select the best definition of 'authorize':

options.A: To happen at the same time as something else
options.B: To give official permission for something to happen
options.C: To prevent someone from participating in an activity
options.D: To make something stronger or more effective

questions.question: Choose the correct definition of 'justify':

options.A: To show or prove that something is reasonable or necessary
options.B: To make something more accurate or precise
options.C: To use something effectively
options.D: To solve a problem or difficulty

questions.question: What does 'accurate' mean?

options.A: To make use of something
options.B: Correct and exact in all details
options.C: A fact or situation that is observed to exist
options.D: To find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem

questions.question: Select the best definition of 'phenomenon':

options.A: A fact or situation that is observed to exist or happen
options.B: The process of finding a solution to a difficult situation
options.C: The quality of being correct or precise
options.D: To use something in an effective way

questions.question: Choose the correct meaning of 'utilize':

options.A: To solve a problem
options.B: To make something more accurate
options.C: To use something in an effective way
options.D: An unusual fact or occurrence

questions.question: What does 'resolve' mean?

options.A: To use something effectively
options.B: To find a satisfactory solution to a problem or difficulty
options.C: To be correct in all details
options.D: An unusual fact or event that can be observed

questions.question: According to the passage, what has AI transformed from?

options.A: A household name
options.B: A distant sci-fi concept
options.C: An email filtering system
options.D: A streaming service

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a way AI enhances smartphone functionality?

options.A: Recognizing speech patterns
options.B: Suggesting predictive text
options.C: Enhancing photography
options.D: Improving battery life

questions.question: According to paragraph 2, how has AI affected customer service?

options.A: By completely replacing human agents
options.B: By resolving common issues instantly through chatbots
options.C: By creating more complex problems
options.D: By eliminating the need for emotional intelligence

options.A: Healthcare
options.B: Education
options.C: Entertainment
options.D: Transportation

questions.question: What concern about AI is mentioned in the passage?

options.A: Environmental impact
options.B: Potential job displacement
options.C: Physical safety risks
options.D: Cultural homogenization

questions.question: According to the passage, what must educational systems do in response to AI?

options.A: Replace teachers with AI systems
options.B: Eliminate technology from classrooms
options.C: Adapt to prepare students for an automated workforce
options.D: Focus exclusively on coding skills

questions.question: What does the passage suggest is the ultimate goal regarding AI?

options.A: To reduce human involvement in technology
options.B: To harness AI as a tool that enhances human potential
options.C: To prevent any further AI development
options.D: To separate technology from humanity

questions.question: The word \”tremendous\” in paragraph 4 is closest in meaning to:

options.A: Concerning
options.B: Minimal
options.C: Remarkable
options.D: Unexpected

questions.question: What does the passage suggest about the relationship between AI and privacy?

options.A: AI has eliminated privacy concerns completely
options.B: AI interactions generate data that raises privacy concerns
options.C: Privacy issues are unrelated to AI development
options.D: Companies no longer collect user data

questions.question: The passage primarily focuses on:

options.A: The history of artificial intelligence development
options.B: How AI is integrated into and reshaping everyday life
options.C: Technical explanations of how AI systems function
options.D: Future predictions about AI advancement
